The Four Truths [an4.159:9.6]: This body is produced by food. Relying on food, you should give up food.
This body is produced by craving. Relying on craving, you should give up craving.
This body is produced by conceit. Relying on conceit, you should give up conceit.
This body is produced by sex. The Buddha spoke of breaking off everything to do with sex.
The process of giving up [an4.159:9.6]: Take a mendicant who reflects properly on the food that they eat
After some time, relying on food, they give up food

Take a mendicant who hears this: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’ They think: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. …’
After some time, relying on craving, they give up craving

Take a mendicant who hears this: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.’ They think: ‘Well, that venerable can realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. … Why can’t I?’
After some time, relying on conceit, they give up conceit.
